summary: The Thirteenth United States Census was done by the Census Bureau on April 15, 1910. It found the population of the United States to be 92,228,496. This was an increase of 21.0 percent from the 1900 Census.
full_text: The Thirteenth United States Census, conducted by the Census Bureau on April 15, 1910, determined the resident population of the United States to be 92,228,496, an increase of 21.0 percent over the 76,212,168 persons enumerated during the 1900 Census. The 1910 Census switched from a portrait page orientation to a landscape orientation.
title: 1910 United States Census
